meanings.definition: Having a lower temperature than before.
meanings.sent1: The ice cream became colder in the freezer.
meanings.sent2: The weather is getting colder as winter approaches.
meanings.sent3: I like my drinks colder than the North Pole!
meanings.sent4: His stare was colder than a winter's night.
meanings.sent5: The chill in the air grew colder with each passing hour.

meanings.sent1: This soup is colder than the one I had yesterday.
meanings.sent2: Today is colder than yesterday, but tomorrow will be even colder.
meanings.sent3: She gave him a look colder than an iceberg.
meanings.sent4: The news hit him like a colder reality setting in.
meanings.sent5: The competition between the two teams grew colder as the game progressed.
